Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.1103, 0.0]. Line 2: Start point at [0.1103, 0.0], end point at [0.1103, 0.75]. Line 3: Start point at [0.1103, 0.75], end point at [0.0, 0.75]. Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.75], end point at [0.0, 0.0]. Close the loop and finish the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.0022 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" for the operation. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.75, 0.0022, and 0.75 units, respectively. Part 2: Construct a longer, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system for part 2. The euler angles are [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector is [0.1103, 0.0022, 0.0]. Create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines. Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.0022, 0.0]. Line 2: Start point at [0.0022, 0.0], end point at [0.0022, 0.75]. Line 3: Start point at [0.0022, 0.75], end point at [0.0, 0.75]. Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.75], end point at [0.0, 0.0]. Close the loop and finish the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.064 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" for the operation. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.75, 0.064, and 0.75 units, respectively. For the final shape, visualize a rectangular prism with a tapered end. The wider end of the prism is parallel to the shorter side. The tapered end is narrower than the wider end, and the prism is centered in the image. The height, width, and length are determined by the longest dimensions of the individual parts. There are no curves, loops, or faces specified, as the final shape is simply a combination of the rectangular prisms.</description>
